meanings.definition: A secret or underhanded scheme or plot.
meanings.sent1: The intrigue behind the locked door kept everyone guessing.
meanings.sent2: The mystery novel was full of intrigue and suspense.
meanings.sent3: The children's treasure hunt had an element of intrigue with hidden clues.
meanings.sent4: The political intrigue at the royal court was like a complex chess game.
meanings.sent5: The intrigue in the spy movie made it thrilling to watch.

meanings.definition: To arouse the curiosity or interest of; fascinate.
meanings.sent1: The magician's tricks never failed to intrigue the audience.
meanings.sent2: The new science exhibit at the museum intrigued many visitors.
meanings.sent3: The unusual rock formation on the hike intrigued the geology enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: The artist's abstract paintings intrigued viewers with their unique style.
meanings.sent5: The rare bird species in the forest intrigued the birdwatchers.

meanings.definition: To engage in secret or underhanded schemes.
meanings.sent1: The spy would often intrigue against enemy agents.
meanings.sent2: The group of thieves planned to intrigue their way into the vault.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon seemed to intrigue with its clever antics.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox would intrigue its prey before making a move.
meanings.sent5: The scheming villain would always intrigue to achieve his goals.
